alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montezuma County through 830 PM MDT... At 758 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Twin Falls, 21 miles northwest of Shiprock, or 5 miles east of the Four Corners, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Montezuma County, including the following locations... Towaoc. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 13. Colorado 41 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
